descr.p: The BlowFish implements a class to handle Blowfish encryption/decryption of memory buffers, and 2 TStream descendents which decrypts any data that is read from it on the fly, as well as which encrypts the data that is written to it on the fly.

element.name: BFRounds
element.short: Number of rounds in Blowfish encryption.

element.name: PBlowFishKey
element.descr: PBlowFishKey is a simple pointer to a array.

element.name: TBlowFishKey
element.short: Array to hold Blowfish encryption keys
element.descr: TBlowFishKey is a data structure which keeps the encryption or decryption key for the , and classes. It should be filled with the encryption key and passed to the constructor of one of these classes.

element.name: TBFBlock
element.descr: TBFBlock is the basic data structure used by the encrypting/decrypting routines in , and . It is the basic encryption/decryption block for all encrypting/decrypting: all encrypting/decrypting happens on a TBFBlock structure.

element.name: TBlowFish
element.descr: TBlowFish is a simple class that can be used to encrypt/decrypt a single data block with the Encrypt and Decrypt calls. It is used internally by the and classes to encrypt or decrypt the actual data.

element.name: TBlowFish.Create
element.short: Create a new instance of the TBlowFish class
element.descr: Create initializes a new instance of the TBlowFish class: it stores the key Key in the internal data structures so it can be used in later calls to Encrypt and Decrypt.

element.name: TBlowFish.Encrypt
element.descr: Encrypt encrypts the data in Block (always 8 bytes) using the key specified when the TBlowFish instance was created.

element.name: TBlowFish.Decrypt
element.descr: ncrypt decrypts the data in Block (always 8 bytes) using the key specified when the TBlowFish instance was created. The data must have been encrypted with the same key and the Encrypt call.

element.name: EBlowFishError
element.descr: EBlowFishError is used by the , and classes to report errors.

element.name: TBlowFishStream
element.short: Parent class for Blowfish encryption/decryption streams

descr.p: TBlowFishStream is an abstract class which is used as a parent class for and . It simply provides a constructor and storage for a instance and for the source or destination stream.
Do not create an instance of TBlowFishStream directly. Instead create one of the descendent classes TBlowFishEncryptStream or TBlowFishDecryptStream.

element.name: TBlowFishStream.Create
element.short: Create a new instance of the TBlowFishStream class

descr.p: Create initializes a new instance of TBlowFishStream, and creates an internal instance of using AKey and AKeySize. The Dest stream is stored so the descendent classes can refer to it.
Do not create an instance of TBlowFishStream directly. Instead create one of the descendent classes TBlowFishEncryptStream or TBlowFishDecryptStream.
The overloaded version with the KeyPhrase string argument is used for easy access: it computes the Blowfish key from the given string.

element.name: TBlowFishStream.Destroy
element.descr: Destroy cleans up the internal instance.

element.name: TBlowFishStream.BlowFish
element.descr: BlowFish is the instance which is created when the TBlowFishStream class is initialized. Normally it should not be used directly, it's intended for access by the descencent classes and .

descr.p: The TBlowFishEncryptStream provides On-the-fly Blowfish encryption: all data that is written to it is encrypted and then written to a destination stream, which must be specified when the TBlowFishEncryptStream instance is created. The encryption key must also be created when the stream instance is created.
This is a write-only stream: it is not seekable, and data can only be written to it, reading is not possible. For reading encrypted data, the stream must be used.

element.name: TBlowFishEncryptStream.Destroy
element.descr: Destroy flushes the encryption buffer, and writes it to the destination stream. After that the Inherited destructor is called to clean up the TBlowFishEncryptStream instance.

element.name: TBlowFishEncryptStream.Read
element.descr: Read will raise an EBlowFishError exception: TBlowFishEncryptStream is a write-only stream.
element.errors: Calling this function always results in an exception.

element.name: TBlowFishEncryptStream.Read.Buffer
element.short: Buffer in which to store read data

descr.p: Write will encrypt and write Count bytes from Buffer to the destination stream. The function returns the actual number of bytes written. The data is not encrypted in-place, but placed in a special buffer for encryption.

Data is always written 4 bytes at a time, since this is the amount of bytes required by the Blowfish algorithm. If no multiple of 4 was written to the destination stream, the Flush mechanism can be used to write the remaining bytes.

element.name: TBlowFishEncryptStream.Write.Buffer
element.short: Buffer containing data to be written.

element.name: TBlowFishEncryptStream.Seek
element.short: Set the position in the stream
element.descr: Read will raise an EBlowFishError exception: TBlowFishEncryptStream is a write-only stream, and cannot be positioned.
element.errors: Calling this function always results in an exception.

descr.p: Flush writes the remaining data in the encryption buffer to the destination stream.

For efficiency, data is always written 4 bytes at a time, since this is the amount of bytes required by the Blowfish algorithm. If no multiple of 4 was written to the destination stream, the Flush mechanism can be used to write the remaining bytes.
Flush is called automatically when the stream is destroyed, so there is no need to call it after all data was written and the stream is no longer needed.

The TBlowFishDecryptStream provides On-the-fly Blowfish decryption: all data that is read from the source stream is decrypted before it is placed in the output buffer. The source stream must be specified when the TBlowFishDecryptStream instance is created. The Decryption key must also be created when the stream instance is created, and must be the same key as the one used when encrypting the data.
This is a read-only stream: it is seekable only in a forward direction, and data can only be read from it, writing is not possible. For writing data so it is encrypted, the stream must be used.

element.name: TBlowFishDeCryptStream.Read
element.descr: Read reads Count bytes from the source stream, decrypts them using the key provided when the TBlowFishDeCryptStream instance was created, and writes the decrypted data to Buffer

element.name: TBlowFishDeCryptStream.Read.Buffer
element.short: Memory buffer in which to place data

element.name: TBlowFishDeCryptStream.Read.Count
element.short: Number of bytes to read from the stream

element.name: TBlowFishDeCryptStream.Write
element.descr: Write will raise an EBlowFishError exception: TBlowFishDecryptStream is a write-only stream.
element.errors: Calling this function always results in an exception.

element.name: TBlowFishDeCryptStream.Write.Buffer
element.short: Buffer with data to be written.

element.name: TBlowFishDeCryptStream.Seek
element.descr: Seek emulates a forward seek by reading and discarding data. The discarded data is lost. Since it is a forward seek, this means that only soFromCurrent can be specified for Origin with a positive (or zero) Offset value. All other values will result in an exception. The function returns the new position in the stream.
element.errors: If any other combination of Offset and Origin than the allowed combination is specified, then an exception will be raised.

element.name: TBlowFishDeCryptStream.Seek.Offset
element.short: Offset. Only zero or positive values allowed.
